narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: As a student who is interested in topics such as sociology and history, this course did such a wonderful job to keep me engaged in the topic of multiracial. the course made me challenge the concept of race from the beginning, and how fluid the concept actually is. Race is something that can be shaped depending on who has the power. Readings and discussions of Hawaii intrigued me the most, because of the unique society in Hawaii. With such large number of multiracial population, it was interesting to see how different Hawaiians approach race. At the same time, I learned that the idolization of Hawaii as a racial paradise carries a lot of flaws, including how Hawaii became the place of such diverse ethnicities. The main reason is colonization of Hawaii, which can never be ignored.

By taking this course, I developed a deeper understanding of the complexities surrounding multiracial identities and their intersections with power, privilege, and racism. Through close readings, discussions, and engagement with diverse perspectives, I honed my critical thinking and sociological analytic skills. The course encouraged me to reflect on my own identity and subjectivity, allowing me to better contextualize my experiences within broader discourses on race and inequality. I gained insights into the challenges multiracial individuals face in navigating social spaces and the role of media and popular culture in shaping perceptions. Overall, this course empowered me to analyze, agitate, and contribute to building a more inclusive and just society.

I have numerous new insights that I got from this class. Most of them are related to interracial identity, blood quantum, one-drop rule, as well as many heartwrenching experiences faced by multiracial people.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I love that in every class time we had discussions on topic for that day. I like how we not only learned multiracial identities and politics of U.S, but other countries internationally.

There's no weaknesses. The selection of readings, encompassing scholarly, literary, editorial, and visual texts, offers a well-rounded exploration of multiracial identities and their social implications. The course's emphasis on critical thinking and reflection encourages personal growth and understanding of intersecting identities.

Strengths: its engagement with all the students, the insightful material, and how our Professor presents it in the class.
Weakness: -

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I would highly recommend this course to another student. It offers a thought-provoking and comprehensive exploration of multiracial identities and their complexities, encouraging critical thinking and reflection. The course's focus on sociological analytic skills and collective knowledge production equips students to address pressing issues of race and inequality in society. Moreover, the opportunity to explore personal identities and subjectivities in relation to larger discourses fosters a deeper understanding of oneself and the broader world. Overall, this course provides an invaluable opportunity to expand one's understanding of race, identity, and social justice, making it a compelling and transformative learning experience.

I would definitely recommend this course to another student. Everyone who wants to dig deep into identity and race should take this class because it gives enough overview and depth to the issue related to identity.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: I am back home in South Korea now, and I am currently looking for volunteering opportunities for multiracial families and children. I believe I would learn a lot more about them and how Korean society treats them.

The knowledge and skills I gained from this course on multiracial identities and social justice will be invaluable in my future endeavors. As I move forward, I will use my strengthened critical thinking and sociological analytic abilities to engage with complex issues of race and intersectionality in various settings. Whether in academic pursuits, community activism, or professional work, I will draw on the insights gained from this course to contribute to building more inclusive and equitable spaces. Moreover, the course's emphasis on understanding power dynamics and privilege will inform my approach to dismantling systemic inequalities and advocating for marginalized communities. Overall, the lessons learned in this course will shape my commitment to promoting social justice and fostering dialogue that recognizes the complexities of diverse identities in tackling broader societal challenges.
I will use the knowledge to sharpen my perspective to perceive social issues related to identity and race.
